item.title: I am not a N00b! - Telling vCenter to stop showing you getting started pages!
item.description: I should have found this years ago. Like most of you reading this I get bugged by vCenter presuming this is my first Rodeo, as they say. Everytime you go to a new Datacentre/Cluster/Folder/VM* (Delete as appropriate) it gives me the Getting Started pages. So today I found the off switches: For C# Client Select Edit > Client Settings Select the General tab Deselect the Show Getting Started Tabs check box and click OK For the Web Client

item.title: VMware News Roundup - Announcement-ageddon!!!
item.description: There was armageddon, then snowmageddon and now announcementageddon. Twitter is on fire with frantic retweeting and updates on what people are excited about on the VMware front. And there’s plenty to be excited about right now. The biggest unsurprising but best bit is vSphere 6.0 goes GA. Now everyone can try long distance vmotion, VVols, 4vcpu Fault Tolerance, Instant Clone and more. item.title: Allowing automated installs of newer VMtools than the host version (Caveat for Trend Deep Security)
item.description: During a recent patching cycle VMtools across a set of VMs were updated to the latest version. This was to patch security vulnerabilities in the versions which were running to ensure the environment was as secure as possible for a PenTest which would go towards IL3 Accreditation. Shavlik was good enough to oblige here and went out and patched lots of VMs with new VMtools automatically to the latest version.
